en.purpose: To assist clinicians to diagnose multiple sclerosis.
en.use:
Use in patients with suspected MS who have undergone MRI.
Variables: 
- Clinical attacks: Must have ≥1 clinical attack
   Number of clinical attacks: (“Clinical attack” = monophasic clinical episode with patient-reported symptoms and objective findings reflecting inflammatory demyelinating CNS event (focal or multifocal), subacute or acute, for ≥24 hrs, with or without recovery, and no fever or infection present; attack, relapse, exacerbation, and clinically isolated syndrome (first episode) are all synonymous)


- Lesions: Must have ≥1 lesion: 
   Number of lesions with objective clinical evidence: (“Objective clinical evidence” = abnormality on neurologic exam, imaging (MRI or optical coherence tomography), or visual evoked potentials, corresponding to anatomical location suggested by symptoms)


- Historical evidence of a previous attack involving a lesion in a distinct anatomical location (Yes, No)


Additional data: (Yes, No)
- Dissemination in time demonstrated by additional clinical attack or MRI, or presence of CSF-specific oligoclonal bands

- Dissemination in space demonstrated by an additional clinical attack implicating a different CNS site or by MRI

Interpretation: 
Clinical attacks        Number of lesions with objective clinical evidence        Additional data needed for diagnosis of MS
≥2                              ≥2                                                                                            No additional tests required to demonstrate dissemination in space and time
≥2                               1 (as well as clear-cut historical evidence of a                  No additional tests required to demonstrate dissemination in space and time
                                    previous attack involving a lesion in a distinct 
                                    anatomical location)
≥2                                1                                                                                             Dissemination in space demonstrated by an additional clinical attack implicating a                                                                                                                                                                          different CNS site or by MRI


1                                     ≥2                                                                                          Dissemination in time demonstrated by additional clinical attack or MRI, or presence of CSF-specific                                                                                                                                       oligoclonal bands
en.misuse: Not to use to differentiate MS from other conditions.

other_details.references: 1. Thompson AJ, Banwell BL, Barkhof F, et al. Diagnosis of multiple sclerosis: 2017 revisions of the McDonald criteria. Lancet Neurol. 2017.
